title.rendered: Latest News: UK organisations advised to bolster their cyber security resilience

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1643362910116{margin-top: 30px !important;padding-bottom: 30px !important;}”]UK organisations are being urged to bolster their cyber security resilience in response to the malicious cyber incidents in and around Ukraine.

It comes after the Government has published its new National Cyber Strategy which sets out how the UK will solidify its position as a global cyber power.

To can read the full National Cyber Strategy full report please visit the GOV UK website.

While the NCSC is not aware of any current specific threats to UK organisations in relation to events in and around Ukraine, it issues guidance for organisations to follow these actionable steps that reduce the risk of falling victim to an attack, including:

  • patching systems;

Patching vulnerable systems is a critical step in protecting against this vulnerability. Look at the news or advisory pages for all software products you use and ensure that you test and install patches for affected software.

You can also contact Falanx for penetration testing to help find vulnerable systems.

 

 

 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row]
